trial_identification.studytitle: Comparing cough reflex sensitivity in chronic cough patients before, during and after speech pathology intervention.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparing cough reflex sensitivity in chronic cough patients before, during and after speech pathology intervention.

interventions.interventions: Cough specific speech therapy 1hour/session for a duration of 4 sessions.
interventions.comparator: measure of cough hypersensitivity and cough frequency before, during and after each speech treatment session.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Decrease in Cough Reflex Sensitivity (C5) by 1.2uMol.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Pre-speech treatment session 1, then after each subsequent speech session and finally post-speech treatments (4 sessions completed)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Pre-speech treatment session 1, then after each subsequent speech session and finally post-speech treatments (4 sessions completed)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: return to normal thoraco-abdominal breathing as determined by chart readout from inductance plethsmyograph with powerlab analogue to digital converter.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Pre-speech treatment session 1, then after each subsequent speech session and finally post-speech treatments (4 sessions completed)
before first speech session and post speech sessions (4 in total).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: A persistent cough of eight or more weeks duration Aged between 18 and 80 years A non-smoker No other active lung or heart problem Have been well over the last four weeks
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Current Smoker or smoking history > 10 pack Years, Pregnancy/breast feeding, Other respiratory disease such as bronchiectasis, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), inability to attend study/speech sessions, respiratory tract infection during month prior to treatment.

trial_design.concealment: Patients with chronic cough are referred to the outpatient speech pathology clinic where they are informed about the research study and offered participation. The patient can select to enter the trial or just continue with usual standard treatment of cough by a speech pathologist.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of this study is to investigate the effects of speech pathology treatment on chronic (persistent) cough. It is expected that the treatment will have a positive effect on cough by decreasing a person's cough sensitivity, frequency and severity and by increasing a person's cough quality of life.
